## IdleTimer

### start

#### Parameters

-   `time` **[Number][225]** time in milliseconds (optional, default `15000`)

Returns **void** @memberof IdleTimer

### reset

resets the timer, does not call subscribed functions

Returns **void** @memberof IdleTimer

### stop

Returns **void** @memberof IdleTimer

### dispatch

Calls all subscribed functions, and resets the timer.

Returns **void** @memberof IdleTimer

### subscribe

Adds a function to be called when timer is dispatched

#### Parameters

-   `callback`  

Returns **void** @memberof IdleTimer

### unsubscribe

Removes a function from being called when timer is dispatched

#### Parameters

-   `callback` **any** 

Returns **void** @memberof IdleTimer

## UserData

Manages data between SpringRoll Container and SpringRoll

Gets data from SpringRoll Container

#### Parameters

-   `name` **[string][227]** 

Returns **[Promise][228]** 

### write

#### Parameters

-   `name` **[string][227]** 
-   `value` **any** 

Returns **[Promise][228]** 

### delete

Removes data from SpringRoll Container

#### Parameters

-   `name` **[string][227]** 

## PositionCallback

callback to used move game entities

Type: [Function][226]

### Parameters

-   `position` **[Point][229]** position relative to anchor direction

## Anchor

Used to fix positions to a relative point in the viewport.

### onResize

#### Parameters

-   `param` **[object][230]** 
    -   `param.offset` **[Point][229]** 
    -   `param.gameSize` **[Point][229]** 

Returns **void** @memberof Anchor

### calcWorldPosition

Calculates and returns the world position of a single axis
Based on viewport offset and anchor direction.

#### Parameters

-   `position` **[Number][225]** 
-   `direction` **[Number][225]** 
-   `offset` **[Number][225]** 
-   `halfSize` **[Number][225]** 

Returns **void** @memberof Anchor

Type: {x: [Number][225], y: [Number][225]}

## SafeScaleManager

Handles scaling the game

### Parameters

-   `$0` **[Object][230]** 
    -   `$0.width`  
    -   `$0.height`  
    -   `$0.safeWidth`   (optional, default `Infinity`)
    -   `$0.safeHeight`   (optional, default `Infinity`)
    -   `$0.callback`  
-   `param` **[object][230]** 

### entities

Type: [Array][232]&lt;[ScaledEntity][233]>

### removeEntity

Removes an anchor

#### Parameters

-   `entity` **[ScaledEntity][233]** 

Returns **void** @memberof SafeScaleManager

### enable

Enables the scale manager listener. Will not be enabled if a callback is not supplied.

#### Parameters

-   `callback` **[ScaleCallback][234]** The function to be called on resize events.

### disable

Disables the scale manager.

### calcOffset

Calculates the offset for anchors.

#### Parameters

-   `scale` **[Point][229]** scale value

Returns **[Point][229]** 

### addEntity

Adds and anchor to be updated during resize

#### Parameters

-   `entity` **[ScaledEntity][233]** 

## ScaleCallback

callback to used scale game and canvas

Type: [Function][226]

### Parameters

-   `width` **[Number][225]** width canvas should be
-   `height` **[Number][225]** height canvas should be
-   `scale` **[Point][229]** x/y scale values

## resizeEventData

Type: [EntityResizeEvent][231]

## ScaleManager

Simplifies listening to resize events by passing the relevant data to a provided callback.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][226]**  (optional, default `undefined`)

### Properties

-   `callback` **[Function][226]?** 

### enable

Enables the scale manager listener. Will not be enabled if a callback is not supplied.

#### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][226]** The function to be called on resize events.

### disable

Disables the scale manager.

## SpeechSynth

SpeechSync makes it easy to convert text to speech.
Note: This is not supported on IE11 and below because of the underlying APIs are not implemented in those browsers

### Parameters

-   `params` **[object][230]** 
    -   `params.voice` **[number][225]** Indicates what voice to use. (optional, default `0`)
    -   `params.rate` **[number][225]** The rate at which the text is said. Supports a range from 0.1 to 10. (optional, default `1`)
    -   `params.pitch` **[number][225]** Voice Pitch. Supports a pitch from 0 to 2. (optional, default `0`)
    -   `params.volume` **[number][225]** Volume. Supports 0 to 1. (optional, default `1`)

### Properties

-   `voicesLoaded` **[boolean][235]** voices are loaded async. This is will be set to true when they are loaded.

### pause

Pauses the announcer.

### resume

Resumes the announcer.

### cancel

Pauses the announcer and clears the queue.

### say

Causes the announcer to say whatever message is passed to it.
If the announcer is already saying something then it will be added to a queue.

#### Parameters

-   `message` **[string][227]** 

### setVoice

Sets the voice by array index.

#### Parameters

-   `index` **[number][225]** 

### getVoice

Returns the voice object.

Returns **([object][230] | null)** 

### rate

Rate at which text is spoken.

#### Parameters

-   `rate` **[number][225]** 

### rate

Returns rate which text is spoken.

Returns **[number][225]** 

### pitch

Sets the pitch at which text is spoken.

#### Parameters

-   `pitch` **[number][225]** 

### pitch

Returns the pitch at which text is spoken.

Returns **[number][225]** 

### volume

Sets the current volume of the announcer.

#### Parameters

-   `volume` **[number][225]** 

### volume

Returns the current volume of the announcer.

Returns **[number][225]** 

## filterType

Type: (`"protanopia"` \| `"protanomaly"` \| `"deuteranopia"` \| `"deuteranomaly"` \| `"tritanopia"` \| `"tritanomaly"` \| `"achromatopsia"` \| `"achromatomaly"`)

## ColorFilter

The Color filter allows you to simulate colorblindness.

### applyFilter

Applies the specified filter to the element.

#### Parameters

-   `element` **[HTMLElement][236]** 
-   `type` **[filterType][237]** 

### changeFilter

Changes the currently applied filter to the element if the color filter has it.

#### Parameters

-   `type` **[filterType][237]** 

Returns **any** 

### removeFilter

Removes the filter from the element.

### types

Supported filter types.

Returns **[object][230]** Returns an object { name, value } with the colorblindness type:
(Protanopia, Protanomaly, Deuteranopia, Deuteranomaly, Tritanopia, Tritanomaly, Achromatopsia, Achromatomaly)

## KeyState

Type: (`0` \| `1` \| `2`)

### Properties

-   `down` **[Function][226]** 
-   `up` **[Function][226]** 
-   `key` **[string][227]** 

## Controller

Controller interface class to simplify working with key presses.

### Parameters

-   `buttons` **[Array][232]&lt;KeyTemplate>** An object containing all keys you want to watch and their functions. e.g. {enter: () => {}}. See [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/key/Key_Values][238] for potential values. (optional, default `[]`)

### update

Calls all functions for buttons that are currently set to enabled.

### onKeyDown

Called on keyup. Sets flag to 1 if key is being watched.

#### Parameters

-   `e` **[KeyboardEvent][239]** 

### onKeyUp

Called on keyup. Sets flag to 2 if key is being watched.

#### Parameters

-   `e` **[KeyboardEvent][239]** 

### assignButtons

Sets an object of button functions to the controller to be called.

#### Parameters

-   `keys` **[Array][232]&lt;KeyTemplate>** 

## Key

Represents a single key on the keyboard and the functions related to it.

### Parameters

-   `key` **[string][227]** What this object represents.
-   `down` **[Function][226]** Function to be called while the key is held down. (optional, default `()=>{}`)
-   `up` **[Function][226]** Function to be called when the key is lifted up. (optional, default `()=>{}`)

### Properties

-   `state` **(`0` \| `1` \| `2`)** The current state of the key. 0 = inactive, 1 = active, 2 = to be set to inactive.
-   `key` **[string][227]** The name of the key we are targeting.
-   `actions` **[object][230]** 
    -   `actions.down` **[function][226]** Function to be called while the key is held down.
    -   `actions.up` **[function][226]** Function to be called when the key is lifted up.

### updateState

Updates the internal state of the key. Accepts a range between 0-2. Will set key state to 0 if nothing is passed.

#### Parameters

-   `state` **(`0` \| `1` \| `2`)**  (optional, default `0`)

### action

Calls the relevant action for the current state of the key.

### state

Returns the current state of the key.

Returns **[number][225]** 

## Application

Main entry point for a game. Provides a single focal point for plugins and functionality to attach.

### Properties

-   `features` **[object][230]** A configuration object denoting which features are enabled for this application
    -   `features.captions` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean value denoting that this game supports captions
    -   `features.sound` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean value denoting that this game has some audio in it
    -   `features.vo` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has mutable voice-over audio in it
    -   `features.music` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has mutable music in it
    -   `features.sfx` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has mutable sound effects in it
    -   `features.soundVolume` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable sound volume in it
    -   `features.musicVolume` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable music volume in it
    -   `features.voVolume` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable voice-over volume in it
    -   `features.sfxVolume` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable sound effects volume in it
    -   `features.pointerSize` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable pointer size in it
    -   `features.controlSensitivity` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable control sensitivity in it
    -   `features.buttonSize` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable button sizes in it
    -   `features.removableLayers` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has removable game layers in it
    -   `features.hudPosition` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has custom HUD positions.
    -   `features.difficulty` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has adjustable difficulty/speed.
    -   `features.keyBinding` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has re-mappable key bindings.
    -   `features.colorVision` **[boolean][235]?** A boolean denoting that this game has color blindess filters

### getPlugin

returns instance of a plugin.

#### Parameters

-   `name` **[string][227]** 

Returns **(SpringRoll.ApplicationPlugin | [undefined][240])** 

### validateListeners

Validates that appropriate listeners are added for the features that were enabled in the constructor

-   Throws **any** Error

### setupPlugins

preloads, initializes and starts plugins.

Returns **[Promise][228]&lt;void>** 

### \_plugins

The list of plugins that are currently registered to run on Applications.

### uses

Registers a plugin to be used by applications, sorting it by priority order.

#### Parameters

-   `plugin` **SpringRoll.ApplicationPlugin** The plugin to register.

### getPlugin

Finds a plugin by name.

#### Parameters

-   `name` **[string][227]** The name of the plugin.

Returns **(SpringRoll.ApplicationPlugin | [undefined][240])** 

## Debugger

Type: [object][230]

### Parameters

-   `params` **[Object][230]** Options
    -   `params.emitEnabled` **[boolean][235]** If this should emit events to the window. (optional, default `false`)
    -   `params.minLevel` **(`"GENERAL"` \| `"DEBUG"` \| `"INFO"` \| `"WARN"` \| `"ERROR"`)** The starting log level for the logger. (optional, default `'GENERAL'`)

### Properties

-   `emitEnabled` **[boolean][235]** 
-   `enabled` **[boolean][235]** 
-   `minLevel` **[number][225]** 

### params

Returns the params of the debugger.

Returns **DebuggerParams** 

### minLevel

Sets the logging level of the debugger.

#### Parameters

-   `level` **([string][227] \| [number][225])** The name of the level.

Returns **void** 

### emit

If emitting is enabled for this instance, then it will dispatch an event on the window.

#### Parameters

-   `eventName` **[string][227]** Name of the event (optional, default `'Debugger'`)

### LEVEL

Returns logging levels.

Returns **[object][230]** 

### log

Console logs all supplied arguments if the log level is low enough for them to be logged.

#### Parameters

-   `type` **(`"log"` \| `"general"` \| `"warn"` \| `"error"` \| `"debug"` \| `"info"`)** minimum level for this log to run at (optional, default `'log'`)
-   `args` **[Array][232]&lt;any>** Arguments you wish to log.

### assert

Will throw if statement is false.

#### Parameters

-   `isTrue` **[boolean][235]** The expression to evaluate.

### isEnabled

Returns a boolean indicating if the debugger has been enabled or not.

Returns **[boolean][235]** 

### enable

Disables or enables all debugger instances.
TODO: Remove the parameter here, and add a disable method as well

#### Parameters

-   `flag` **[boolean][235]** 

Returns **void** 

### paramKey

Returns the global params key.

## Property

A class for representing changeable/subscribable properties.

### Properties

-   `_value` **any** the value of the property
-   `listeners` **\[]** all the objects listening to this property

### subscribe

Adds a subscriber to this property.

#### Parameters

-   `callback` **[function][226]** The callback to call whenever the property changes.

### unsubscribe

Unsubscribes a listener from this property.

#### Parameters

-   `callback` **[function][226]** The callback to unsubscribe.

### hasListeners

Whether or not this property has any subscribed listeners

Returns **[Boolean][235]** True if this property has at least one subscriber

### value

returns the current value of the property

Returns **any** 

### value

Sets the value of the property and notifies all listeners of the change

#### Parameters

-   `value` **any** the new property value

## Caption

### Properties

-   `lines` **[Array][232]&lt;[TimedLine][241]>** 
-   `time` **[number][225]** 
-   `lineIndex` **[number][225]** 
-   `renderer` **[IRender][242]** 

### update

Updates content based on time passed.
This ~should~ be called every frame that the caption is active.

#### Parameters

-   `deltaTime` **[Number][225]** Time in seconds since last frame.

### updateState

Handles calling callbacks and updating caption's current state.

#### Parameters

-   `currentTime` **[Number][225]** 
-   `lastTime` **[Number][225]** 

### isFinished

Checks if caption has completed.

Returns **[Boolean][235]** 

### start

Sets time and line index of caption.

#### Parameters

-   `time` **[Number][225]** Time in milliseconds. (optional, default `0`)
-   `renderer`   (optional, default `{lineBegin:()=>{},lineEnd:()=>{}}`)

### updateTimeIndex

Updates the current time and index of the caption instance

#### Parameters

-   `time` **[Number][225]**  (optional, default `0`)

## CaptionFactory

Collection of functions for creating Captions

### createCaptionMap

Creates a new Object&lt;String, Caption>.

#### Parameters

-   `data` **[JSON][243]** 

Returns **[Object][230]** 

### createCaption

Creates a new Caption from JSON data.

#### Parameters

-   `captionData` **any** 

Returns **[Caption][244]** new Caption

### createLine

Creates a new TimedLine from JSON data.

#### Parameters

-   `lineData` **any** 

Returns **[TimedLine][241]** new TimedLine;

## CaptionPlayer

CaptionPlayer is used to start, stop and update captions.
 It applies the content of an active caption to a given CaptionRenderer.

### update

Updates any currently playing caption.
This ~should~ be called every frame.

#### Parameters

-   `deltaTime` **[Number][225]** Time passed in seconds since last update call.

### start

Starts playing a caption.

#### Parameters

-   `name` **[String][227]** Name of caption.
-   `time` **[number][225]** Atart time in milliseconds. (optional, default `0`)
-   `args` **[object][230]** Arguments that will get passed to the renderer (optional, default `{}`)

### stop

Stops any caption currently playing.

## CaptionPlayer

### Parameters

-   `captions`  
-   `renderer`  

### update

Updates any currently playing caption.
This ~should~ be called every frame.

#### Parameters

-   `deltaTime` **[Number][225]** Time passed in seconds since last update call.

### start

Starts playing a caption.

#### Parameters

-   `name` **[String][227]** Name of caption.
-   `time` **[number][225]** Atart time in milliseconds. (optional, default `0`)
-   `args` **[object][230]** Arguments that will get passed to the renderer (optional, default `{}`)

### stop

Stops any caption currently playing.

## TimedLine

### Properties

-   `startTime` **[number][225]** 
-   `endTime` **[number][225]** 
-   `content` **[string][227]** 

### setContent

Sets line's content. Removes HTML formatting for text.

#### Parameters

-   `content` **any** 

Returns **void** @memberof TimedLine

## IRender

Render interface to help enforce minimum requirements for caption renderers

### Properties

-   `start` **[function][226]** called when the Caption Player starts playing captions
-   `stop` **[function][226]** called when the Caption Player stops playing captions
-   `lineBegin` **[function][226]** called when rendering a new line of text
-   `lineEnd` **[function][226]** called when finished rendering a new of text

## DOMRenderer

DOMRender is a incomplete renderer that is intended to supply just the basic start and stop functions

### Parameters

-   `element` **[HTMLElement][236]** 
-   `templateVariables` **[Object][230]** 

### start

Makes target element visible and ready to present captions

#### Parameters

-   `templateVariables` **[object][230]** Variables that can used during caption play time (optional, default `{}`)

### stop

H

## HtmlRenderer

HTML Renderer is intended for rendering raw html in the use case of wanting to display styled captions

### lineBegin

Called by Caption Player when a new line needs to be displayed

#### Parameters

-   `line`  

### lineEnd

Called by Caption Player when a line is complete

## TemplateRenderer

TemplateRenderer accepts a string template e.g.`The ball is {{color}}` and a args object e.g. `{color: 'red'}`
and swaps out the placeholder inside the double brackets with the matching key inside the args object

### Parameters

-   `template` **[string][227]** String template that will be rendered with the supplied arguments
-   `args` **[Object][230]** //An Object contain data to be inserted into the template This will match based on key values

Returns **[string][227]** 

## TextRenderer

TextRenderer is intended for just rendering test. It will attempt to sanitize any strings passed to it by removing html syntax

### lineBegin

Called by Caption Player when a new line needs to be displayed

#### Parameters

-   `line`  

### lineEnd

Called by Caption Player when a line is complete

### sanitize

Will attempt to remove all html from a string before it's renderer to the page

#### Parameters

-   `html` **any** 

## Localizer.Options

Type: {language: [string][227], fallback: [string][227]}

## Localizer

### resolve

#### Parameters

-   `path` **[string][227]** 
-   `options` **any**  (optional, default `{}`)

Returns **{path: [string][227], language: [string][227]}** 

### setPrimaryLocale

#### Parameters

-   `localeKey` **[string][227]** 

Returns **[boolean][235]** True if language is set.

### setFallbackLocale

#### Parameters

-   `localeKey` **[string][227]** 

Returns **[boolean][235]** True if fallback is set.

### getLocaleKey

#### Parameters

-   `localeKey` **[string][227]** 

Returns **[string][227]** 

### getBrowserLanguages

## ApplicationPlugin

Represents a single plugin for applications. Allows developers to inject code in the start up process of an
application providing new features to the application.

### preload

A preload method for the plugin which allows for asynchronous setup tasks. Either takes a callback as first
parameter, or should return a Promise indicating that loading is finished.

Returns **[Promise][228]** A promise indicating when the plugin is finished loading.

### init

An init method for the plugin. This method is ran synchronously in the constructor of the Application.
After all plugins preloads  has completed

### start

A start method for the plugin. This method is ran synchronously in the constructor of the Application.
After all plugins inits has completed
